instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2530 no backlight bad via
threads.message:
Got this old but nice lookin board with no backlight. 
Found a corroded via, <SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN2</SIGNAL>, and the pad is gone next to L9701 but on the other side it look good. Is it possible to fix this? I don?t really understand via but I suppose they connect to traces inside the board.

threads.title: 2530 no backlight bad via
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN2</SIGNAL> goes from <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> (pin 13) to <RESISTOR>R9718</RESISTOR>; run direct wire, if you cannot rebuild the trace.
Also change <RESISTOR>R9718</RESISTOR> if damaged and check continuity to J9000 (pin 25).

As <RESISTOR>R9718</RESISTOR> is 0 ohms, you can directly run the wire from <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> to J9000...
